## calculatePatternConfidence() function

> This API is provided as an alpha preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.
> 

Calculate confidence score for how well a pattern captures a dimensional rule.

This function measures information preservation by comparing: - Action preservation (weighted 3x) - Aspect preservation (weighted 2.5x) - Target preservation (weighted 2x) - Impact preservation (weighted 2x) - Node kind preservation (weighted 1.5x) - Nested flag preservation (weighted 1x) - Release type match (weighted 2x) - Description preservation (weighted 0.5x)

Useful for validating roundtrip transformations or choosing between alternative pattern representations.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function calculatePatternConfidence(dimensional: DimensionalRule, pattern: PatternRule): number;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

dimensional


</td><td>

[DimensionalRule](./change-detector-core.dimensionalrule.md)


</td><td>

The original dimensional rule


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

pattern


</td><td>

[PatternRule](./change-detector-core.patternrule.md)


</td><td>

The proposed pattern representation


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

number

Confidence score between 0 and 1

## Example


```typescript
const dimensional: DimensionalRule = {
  type: 'dimensional',
  action: ['removed'],
  target: ['export'],
  returns: 'major'
}

const pattern: PatternRule = {
  type: 'pattern',
  template: 'removed {target}',
  variables: [{ name: 'target', value: 'export', type: 'target' }],
  returns: 'major'
}

const confidence = calculatePatternConfidence(dimensional, pattern)
// Returns: ~0.9 (high - action, target, and returns all match)
```
